images.alt: A diagram with the five sloth power types: ice, fire, wind, lightning, and none.
A wireframe of an app interface that has an outline of a sloth and four buttons below the sloth. The buttons display the following symbols, from left to right: snowflake, fire, wind, and lightning.
An illustration of 3 iPhones in portrait mode, displaying the UI of finding, creating, and taking care of a sloth in Slothy â€” the sample app that you build in this collection of tutorials.
An arrow pointing from the SlothCreator framework icon to the Xcode app project icon.
A portrait of a generic sloth displayed in the center of the canvas.
A screenshot shows the SlothCreator package in Xcode's navigator.
A portrait of an ice sloth on top, followed by four power icons below. The power icons, clockwise from top left, include: ice, fire, wind, and lightning. The ice icon is selected.
A wireframe of an app interface that has an outline of a sloth and four buttons below the sloth. The buttons display the following symbols, from left to right: ice, fire, wind, and lightning.
An outline of a sloth surrounded by four power type icons. The power type icons are arranged in the following order, clockwise from the top: fire, wind, lightning, and ice.
A screenshot from the Xcode preview as it would appear on iPhone, with the text, Hello, World!, centered in the middle of the display.
A screenshot of a blank preview canvas.
A sloth hanging off a tree.
